entry.title: F-stop ICUs
entry.content:
F-Stop camera bags have an adaptable system for trading camera space for other outdoor gear. The swappable section are called ICUs or Internal Camera Units.

This is not a review but just a quick note to record the default layouts of the Pro-Medium and Pro-Extra Large.

Pro-Medium ICU

Internal Dimensions (external all dimensions 2cm greater)
Depth: 16.5cm. Width: 27cm. Height: 27.5cm External Volume 15.4L

Pro-Extra Large ICU

Internal Dimensions (external all dimensions 2cm greater)
Depth: 16.5cm. Width: 27cm. Height: 46cm External Volume 25L

entry.title: Lightroom Library Metadata Panel
entry.content:
The metadata panel in Lightroom has always felt a little crowded to me. It shows too many dialog boxes or not the ones I want and have to scroll through many panes.

Since most of my photography is uploaded to flickr there are a few section of metadata which are useful.

I use ‘Job Identifier’ as the shoot name, this is the same as the folder I put my RAW files in. Whe I export this becomes part of the file name. My export file name is ‘morganp-Date (YYYYMMDD)-Job Identifier-Filename’.

The title of the image in my flick export is taken from the IPTC ‘title’ . So I really only want these to setting present for my flick exports.

Enter Jeffrey’s “Metadata-Viewer Preset Editor”. This allows you to create custom metadata views with only the fields you require.

The minimal view:

entry.title: Hugin 2013 Released
entry.content:
11 Months since the last Release Hugin 2013.0.0 is released.

One of the best photo stitchers available at any cost.

entry.title: Lightroom 5.3 RC Beta Available
entry.content:
Lightroom 5.3RC

The Lightroom 5.3 release candidate will expire on December 31, 2013.

entry.title: Photographing Stars Avoiding Star Trails
entry.content:
While not attempted getting good images of the milkyway yet every so often I see some good examples and do a little bit more research.

This thread on Canon Rumours pointed me towards the ‘600 Rule’.

As a guide to avoid star trails 600/focal length gives the maximum exposure in seconds avoiding star trails.

600/24mm => 25 Second exposure

Rule of 600 discussed on photo stackexchange
